meanings.definition: A cut of meat taken from the flank of an animal.
meanings.sent1: The butcher displayed fresh flanken in the meat section.
meanings.sent2: My mom cooked delicious flanken for dinner last night.
meanings.sent3: The hungry dog eyed the flanken with longing.
meanings.sent4: The chef skillfully prepared the flanken for the barbecue.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of sizzling flanken filled the kitchen.

meanings.definition: To cut meat into thin slices across the grain.
meanings.sent1: I will flanken the steak before grilling it.
meanings.sent2: She flankened the roast beef for sandwiches.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to flanken the chicken for the stir-fry.
meanings.sent4: He flankens the meat with precision to ensure tenderness.
meanings.sent5: Flankening the meat makes it easier to chew and enjoy.
